pSpider

Class ParallelSpider

  • java.lang.Object
    • pSpider.ParallelSpider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ParallelSpider
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The class that implements the Runnable interface is the one that defines what is to be done by each 'thread' running concurrently. In our case, grabbing pages from the 'work' queue and processing them.
    Author:
    shoop

      private int urlCount

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParallelSpider

        public ParallelSpider(SharedSpiderData data)
        Create a new spider with access to the shared data by passing it a reference. This constructor could be called many times.
        Parameters:
        data - Thread-safe data structure for this program.

      • ParallelSpider

        public ParallelSpider(SharedSpiderData data,
                      java.lang.String startURL)
        Create a new spider with access to the shared data by passing it a reference. Also give it the starting point to begin scraping. This constructor should be called once.
        Parameters:
        data - Thread-safe data structure for this program.
        startURL - Initial URL for crawling.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The method that is executed when you 'start()' a thread with this class. Thus, the thread behavior is here in this run method.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • processPage

        public void processPage(java.lang.String url)
        Retrieves content from a url and processes that content.
        Parameters:
        url - A URL to process.
